There was probably life on Venus and maybe even an intelligent civilization that moved to earth after Venus burned up.

Poorly worded question, first off! Venus's scorching conditions could never have been Earth-like, because Earth is not scorching like Venus. And it never can!

If the quantity of CO2 on Venus (219,000x that on Earth) has not changed much in the last 4 billion years, then it would've had runaway greenhouse warming at the beginning of that massive atmosphere. Runaway greenhouse warming is not dependent upon initial temperature (and you're suggesting it was Earth-like at 91 atmospheres of CO2). And based on the current estimate of +10% for every billion years, Sol was 0.62x as bright as it is today. Even with this reduced sunlight, Venus was still receiving 20% more sunlight than Earth does now. So, no! Venus was never "Earth-like."
